word:
The lawyer refused to take anything except the twenty-five cents he paid for certificate. I will not write all I would like to write. The question you 


                                  -154- 

ask in reference to giving Miller possession, I do not now recollect what I had in mind. As nothing has been said to him about possession, I will not now say anything. Let him handle the matter as he chooses. I have no intentions that I know of; I have made no suggestions to Miller since the last agreement which was that I would give him $1300 (?) difference in trade.--Letter 84, 1891. 

Ellen G. White Estate Washington, D. C. Dec. 17, 1987. Entire Letter.
